class  FT::StoreCheckpointService
 Checkpoint service to store fileOn each process of a Kaapi application, a checkpoint service accepts request from remote node in order to store checkpoint data. Each process has its checkpoint server where it will store its checkpoint data. The default service is FT::StoreCheckpointService::service. The class definition expose both client and server interface.The server side store directly the incomming message that correspond to the serialization of a thread (thus, if the library is compiled with heterogeneous support, the message could be reload from any process). To load checkpoint files that correspond to threads, the FT::LoadCheckpointService::service object should be used. More...
class  FT::LoadCheckpointService
 Checkpoint service to load checkpoint fileThe FT::LoadCheckpointService::service expose both client and server interface to load checkpoint file from the Store service. In order to load a checkpoint file, the implementation re-play the stored message (the checkpoint file) with new destination (the node that requires the checkpoint file) and new service identifier (the LoadCheckpointService::service). More...

class  FT::HeartBeatDetector
 Heartbeat fault tolerance detectorThe algorithm is to send to randomly selected known local node a message at a certain period and to test is a reply was arrived before a certain latency. If not the node is marked as suspected and then marked as failed. In this case, the node is signaled to the kaapicontroller. The HeartBeat detector is controlled by following properties

  • 'ft.fdetector.heartbeat.period' <integer> : the period of heart beat
  • 'ft.fdetector.heartbeat.latency' <integer> : the latency before a node is considered as suspect.
More...
class  FT::SignalCommit
 SignalCommitThis class is the call back that could be defined in order to receive the ack of the commit from the checkpointserver. This service should has been declared as the same service identifier passed to the commit operation on StoreCheckpointService. More...
class  FT::CommunityObject

class  FT::LocalCheckpointController
 Local process controler attached to any running process under the control of a FT protocolSuch a class should extended by a specific FT protocol in order to implement the local part of the control required by a FT protocol. By default method of this class allows to stop all running threads in a checkpointable state and take a snapshot of the process by checkpointing each stopped threads. The role of derivation is to attach the object to a community name in order that theses methods checkpoint the right community. More...

 CheckpointProtocol objectThis object represents a checkpoint protocol. It defines methods that should be implemented. It will be created on all the processes. More...
